description: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3), provides developers and IT teams with secure, durable, highly-scalable cloud storage.

blocks.name: getBuckets
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of all buckets owned by the authenticated sender of the request.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

blocks.name: getSingleBucket
blocks.description: This endpoint returns some or all (up to 1,000) of the objects in a bucket. You can use the request parameters as selection criteria to return a subset of the objects in a bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

args.name: bucketName

blocks.name: getBucketTagging
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the tag set associated with the bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

blocks.name: getBucketObjectVersions
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of metadata about all of the versions of objects in a bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

args.name: delimiter
args.info: Optional: A delimiter is a character that you specify to group keys. All keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter are grouped under a single result element in CommonPrefixes. These groups are counted as one result against the max-keys limitation. These keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. Also, see prefix.

args.name: keyMarker
args.info: Optional: Specifies the key in the bucket that you want to start listing from. Also, see version-id-marker.

args.name: maxKeys
args.info: Optional: Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response body. The response might contain fewer keys, but will never contain more. Default: 1000

args.name: prefix
args.info: Optional: Use this parameter to select only those keys that begin with the specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into different groupings of keys. (You can think of using prefix to make groups in the same way you'd use a folder in a file system.) You can use prefix with delimiter to roll up numerous objects into a single result under CommonPrefixes. Also, see delimiter.

args.name: versionIdMarker
args.info: Optional: Specifies the object version you want to start listing from. Also, see key-marker. Valid Values: Valid version ID | Default

blocks.name: getBucketRequestPayment
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the request payment configuration of a bucket.

args.name: apiKey

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

blocks.name: getBucketVersioning
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the versioning state of a bucket. To retrieve the versioning state of a bucket, you must be the bucket owner.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

blocks.description: This endpoint returns the website configuration associated with a bucket.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

blocks.name: checkBucket
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to determine if a bucket exists and you have permission to access it.

args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

blocks.name: getMultipartUploads
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of in-progress multipart uploads. An in-progress multipart upload is a multipart upload that has been initiated using the Initiate Multipart Upload request, but has not yet been completed or aborted.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of the bucket.

args.name: delimiter
args.info: Optional: Character you use to group keys. All keys that contain the same string between the prefix, if specified, and the first occurrence of the delimiter after the prefix are grouped under a single result element, CommonPrefixes. If you don't specify the prefix parameter, then the substring starts at the beginning of the key. The keys that are grouped under CommonPrefixes result element are not returned elsewhere in the response.

args.name: keyMarker
args.info: Optional: Together with upload-id-marker, this parameter specifies the multipart upload after which listing should begin.

args.name: maxUploads
args.info: Optional: Sets the maximum number of multipart uploads, from 1 to 1,000, to return in the response body. 1,000 is the maximum number of uploads that can be returned in a response. Default: 1,000

args.name: prefix
args.info: Optional: Lists in-progress uploads only for those keys that begin with the specified prefix.

args.name: uploadIdMarker
args.info: Optional: ogether with key-marker, specifies the multipart upload after which listing should begin. If key-marker is not specified, the upload-id-marker parameter is ignored. Otherwise, any multipart uploads for a key equal to the key-marker might be included in the list only if they have an upload ID lexicographically greater than the specified upload-id-marker.

blocks.name: createBucket
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to create a new bucket

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of new bucket.

args.name: bucketRegion
args.info: Required: The region of new bucket.

args.name: cannedAcl
args.info: Optional: The canned ACL to apply to the bucket you are creating. Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | aws-exec-read | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control. Format: value1|value2|...

args.name: grantFullControl
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee the READ, WRITE, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the bucket. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantRead
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to list the objects in the bucket. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantReadACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the bucket ACL. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWrite
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to create, overwrite, and delete any object in the bucket. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWriteACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the bucket ACL. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

blocks.name: putBucketAccelerateConfiguration
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to set the Transfer Acceleration state of an existing bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: status
args.info: Required: Sets the transfer acceleration state of the bucket. Valid Values: Enabled | Suspended

blocks.name: putBucketACL
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to set the permissions on an existing bucket using access control lists (ACL).

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: grants
args.info: Required: Array of json objects. The array of grantees. See README for more details.

args.name: cannedAcl
args.info: Optional: The canned ACL to apply to the bucket you are creating. Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | authenticated-read. Default: private. Format: value1|value2|...

args.name: grantFullControl
args.info: Optional: Allows the specified grantee(s) the READ, WRITE, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the bucket. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantRead
args.info: Optional: Allows the specified grantee(s) to list the objects in the bucket. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantReadACP
args.info: Optional: Allows the specified grantee(s) to read the bucket ACL. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWrite
args.info: Optional: Allows the specified grantee(s) to create, overwrite, and delete any object in the bucket. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWriteACP
args.info: Optional: Allows the specified grantee(s) to write the ACL for the applicable bucket. Default: None. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

blocks.name: putBucketCORS
blocks.description: Sets the cors configuration for your bucket. If the configuration exists, Amazon S3 replaces it.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: CORSRules
args.info: Required: Array of json objects. The array of CORSRules. See README for more details.

blocks.name: putBucketLifecycleConfiguration
blocks.description: Creates a new lifecycle configuration for the bucket or replaces an existing lifecycle configuration.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: rules
args.info: Required: Array of json objects. The lifecycle configuration consisting of one or more rules. See README for more details.

blocks.name: putBucketPolicy
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to add to or replace a policy on a bucket. If the bucket already has a policy, the one in this request completely replaces it.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: policy
args.info: Required: Json object. Policy written in JSON. See README for more details.

blocks.name: putBucketLogging
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to set the logging parameters for a bucket and to specify permissions for who can view and modify the logging parameters.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: targetGrants
args.info: Required: Array of objects. Container for granting information. See README for more information.

args.name: targetBucket
args.info: Optional: Specifies the bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store server access logs. You can have your logs delivered to any bucket that you own, including the same bucket that is being logged. You can also configure multiple buckets to deliver their logs to the same target bucket. In this case you should choose a different TargetPrefix for each source bucket so that the delivered log files can be distinguished by key.

args.name: targetPrefix
args.info: Optional: This element lets you specify a prefix for the keys that the log files will be stored under.

blocks.name: putBucketNotificationConfiguration
blocks.description: This operation replaces the existing notification configuration with the configuration you indecated. If not specified any of optional parameters, notifications are turned off on the bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: lambdaFunctionConfigurations
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. Container for specifying the AWS Lambda notification configuration. See README for more information.

args.name: queueConfigurations
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. Container for specifying the SQS queue configuration for the notification. You can add one or more of these queue configurations, each identifying one or more event types. See README for more information.

args.name: topicConfigurations
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. Container for specifying an SNS topic configuration for the notification. See README for more information.

blocks.name: putBucketReplication
blocks.description: Amazon S3 stores the configuration in the replication subresource associated with the bucket. If the replication subresource does not exist, Amazon S3 creates it; otherwise, Amazon S3 replaces the configuration stored in the subresource.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: rules
args.info: Required: Array of objects. Container for information about a particular replication rules. Replication configuration must have at least one rule and can contain up to 1,000 rules. See README for more information.

args.name: role
args.info: Optional: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role for Amazon S3 to assume when replicating the objects.

blocks.name: putBucketTagging
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to add a set of tags to an existing bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: tagSet
args.info: Required: Array of objects. Container for a set of tags See README for more information.

blocks.name: putBucketRequestPayment
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to add a set of tags to an existing bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: payer
args.info: Required: Specifies who pays for the download and request fees. Valid Values: Requester | BucketOwner

blocks.name: putBucketVersioning
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to set the versioning state of an existing bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: MFA
args.info: Optional: The value is the concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space, and the value displayed on your authentication device. Required to configure the versioning state if versioning is configured with MFA Delete enabled.

args.name: MFADelete
args.info: Optional: Specifies whether MFA Delete is enabled in the bucket versioning configuration. Valid Values: Disabled | Enabled. Can only be used when you use Status.

args.name: status
args.info: Optional: Sets the versioning state of the bucket. Valid Values: Suspended | Enabled

blocks.name: putBucketWebsite
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to set the configuration of the website that is specified.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: indexDocument
args.info: Required: A suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the website endpoint (e.g., if the suffix is index.html and you make a request to samplebucket/images/, the data that is returned will be for the object with the key name images/index.html). The suffix must not be empty and must not include a slash character.

args.name: errorDocument
args.info: Optional: This key identifies the page that is returned when such an error occurs.

args.name: redirectHostName
args.info: Optional: The host name to use in the redirect request.

args.name: redirectProtocol
args.info: Optional: The protocol to use in the redirect request. HTTP || HTTPS

args.name: routingRules
args.info: Optional: Array of objects. Container for a collection of RoutingRule elements. See README for more details.

blocks.name: getSingleObject
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to retrieve objects from Amazon S3.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

args.name: ifMatch
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one specified; otherwise, return a 412 (precondition failed).

args.name: ifModifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).

args.name: ifNoneMatch
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the one specified; otherwise, return a 304 (not modified).

args.name: ifUnmodifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).

args.name: range
args.info: Optional: Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the HTTP Range header, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35.

args.name: responseCacheControl
args.info: Optional: Sets the Cache-Control header of the response.

args.name: responseContentDisposition
args.info: Optional: Sets the Content-Disposition header of the response.

args.name: responseContentEncoding
args.info: Optional: Sets the Content-Encoding header of the response.

args.name: responseContentLanguage
args.info: Optional: Sets the Content-Language header of the response.

args.name: responseContentType
args.info: Optional: Sets the Content-Type header of the response.

args.name: responseExpires
args.info: Optional: Sets the Expires header of the response.

args.name: SSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when decrypting the requested object. Default: None. Valid Values: AES256

args.name: SSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer-provided base64-encoded encryption key to use to decrypt the requested object. This value is used to perform the decryption and then it is discarded; Amazon does not store the key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.

args.name: SSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the customer-provided encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.

blocks.name: getObjectACL
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the access control list (ACL) of an object.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

blocks.name: getObjectTorrent
blocks.description: This endpoint return torrent files from a bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

blocks.name: getObjectMetadata
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves metadata from an object without returning the object itself.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

args.name: ifMatch
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one specified; otherwise, return a 412 (precondition failed).

args.name: ifModifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).

args.name: ifNoneMatch
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the one specified; otherwise, return a 304 (not modified).

args.name: ifUnmodifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).

args.name: range
args.info: Optional: Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the HTTP Range header, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35.

args.name: SSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when decrypting the requested object. Default: None. Valid Values: AES256

args.name: SSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer-provided base64-encoded encryption key to use to decrypt the requested object. This value is used to perform the decryption and then it is discarded; Amazon does not store the key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.

args.name: SSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the customer-provided encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.

blocks.name: restoreArchivedObject
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to restore a temporary copy of an archived object. You can optionally provide version ID to restore specific object version. If version ID is not provided, it will restore the current version.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

args.name: days
args.info: Required: Lifetime of the restored (active) copy. The minimum number of days that you can restore an object from Amazon Glacier is 1. After the object copy reaches the specified lifetime, Amazon S3 removes the copy from the bucket.

args.name: tier
args.info: Required: The retrieval option to use when restoring the archive. Standard is the default. Valid values: Expedited | Standard | Bulk

args.name: versionId
args.info: Optional: version ID to restore specific object version.

blocks.name: addObject
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to add an object to a bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

args.name: objectBody
args.info: Required: File to be uploaded to the bucket.

args.name: acl
args.info: Optional: The canned ACL to apply to the object. Default: private. Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | aws-exec-read | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control

args.name: cacheControl
args.info: Optional: Can be used to specify caching behavior along the request/reply chain. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9.

args.name: contentDisposition
args.info: Optional: Specifies presentational information for the object. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec19.html#sec19.5.1.

args.name: contentEncoding
args.info: Optional: Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.11.

args.name: contentLanguage
args.info: Optional: The language the content is in.

args.name: contentLength
args.info: Optional: The size of the object, in bytes. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13.

args.name: contentType
args.info: Optional: A standard MIME type describing the format of the contents. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.17.

args.name: expires
args.info: Optional: The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.21.

args.name: grantFullControl
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee the READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantRead
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantReadACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object ACL. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWriteACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: metadata
args.info: Optional: Array. A map of metadata to store with the object in S3. Example: ['<string>', ...]

args.name: SSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object. Valid Value: AES256

args.name: SSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer-provided base64-encoded encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.

args.name: SSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.

args.name: SSEKMSKeyId
args.info: Optional: If the x-amz-server-side-encryption is present and has the value of aws:kms, this header specifies the ID of the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) master encryption key that was used for the object.

args.name: serverSideEncryption
args.info: Optional: Specifies a server-side encryption algorithm to use when Amazon S3 creates an object. Valid Value: aws:kms, AES256

args.name: storageClass
args.info: Optional: If you don't specify, Standard is the default storage class. Amazon S3 supports other storage classes. Valid Values: STANDARD | STANDARD_IA | REDUCED_REDUNDANCY

args.name: tagging
args.info: Optional: Specifies a set of one or more tags you want to associated with the object. These tags are stored in the tagging subresource associated with the object.

args.name: websiteRedirectLocation
args.info: Optional: If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.

blocks.name: putObjectACL
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to set the access control list (ACL) permissions for an object that already exists in a bucket.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

args.name: grants
args.info: Required: Array of objects. Container for the grantee and his or her permissions. See README for more details.

args.name: acl
args.info: Optional: The canned ACL to apply to the object. Default: private. Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | aws-exec-read | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control

args.name: grantFullControl
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee the READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantRead
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantReadACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object ACL. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWrite
args.info: Optional: Not applicable when granting access permissions on objects. You can use this when granting access permissions on buckets. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWriteACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: versionId
args.info: Optional: Version of the object whose ACL is being set.

blocks.name: copyObject
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to create a copy of an object that is already stored in Amazon S3.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the source bucket and key name of the source object to be copied, separated by a slash (/).

args.name: copySource
args.info: Required: The name of the source bucket and key name of the source object, separated by a slash (/).

args.name: acl
args.info: Optional: The canned ACL to apply to the object. Default: private. Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | aws-exec-read | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control

args.name: copySourceIfMatch
args.info: Optional: Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) matches the specified tag; otherwise, the request returns a 412 HTTP status code error (failed precondition).

args.name: copySourceIfModifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Copies the object if it has been modified since the specified time; otherwise, the request returns a 412 HTTP status code error (failed condition).

args.name: copySourceIfNoneMatch
args.info: Optional: Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) is different than the specified ETag; otherwise, the request returns a 412 HTTP status code error (failed precondition).

args.name: copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Copies the object if it hasn't been modified since the specified time; otherwise, the request returns a 412 HTTP status code error (failed precondition).

args.name: copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object. Valid Value: AES256. Default: None

args.name: copySourceSSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer-provided base64-encoded encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.

args.name: copySourceSSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header as a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.

args.name: grantFullControl
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee the READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantRead
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantReadACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object ACL. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWriteACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: SSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object. Valid Value: AES256

args.name: SSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer-provided base64-encoded encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.

args.name: SSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.

args.name: SSEKMSKeyId
args.info: Optional: If the x-amz-server-side-encryption is present and has the value of aws:kms, this header specifies the ID of the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) master encryption key that was used for the object.

args.name: serverSideEncryption
args.info: Optional: Specifies a server-side encryption algorithm to use when Amazon S3 creates an object. Valid Value: aws:kms, AES256

args.name: storageClass
args.info: Optional: If you don't specify, Standard is the default storage class. Amazon S3 supports other storage classes. Valid Values: STANDARD | STANDARD_IA | REDUCED_REDUNDANCY

args.name: metadataDirective
args.info: Optional: Specifies whether the metadata is copied from the source object or replaced with metadata provided in the request. Default: COPY. Valid values: COPY | REPLACE

args.name: taggingDirective
args.info: Optional: Specifies whether the object tags are copied from the source object or replaced with tags provided in the request. Default: COPY. Valid values: COPY | REPLACE

args.name: websiteRedirectLocation
args.info: Optional: If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL. Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.

blocks.name: createMultipartUpload
blocks.description: This operation initiates a multipart upload and returns an upload ID. This upload ID is used to associate all of the parts in the specific multipart upload.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName

args.name: objectName

args.name: acl
args.info: Optional: The canned ACL to apply to the object. Default: private. Valid Values: private | public-read | public-read-write | aws-exec-read | authenticated-read | bucket-owner-read | bucket-owner-full-control

args.name: cacheControl
args.info: Optional: Can be used to specify caching behavior along the request/reply chain. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9.

args.name: contentDisposition

args.name: expires
args.info: Optional: The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.21.

args.info: Optional: Allows grantee the READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantRead
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantReadACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to read the object ACL. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: grantWriteACP
args.info: Optional: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object. You specify each grantee as a type=value pair, where the type can be one of the following: emailAddress – if value specified is the email address of an AWS account; id – if value specified is the canonical user ID of an AWS account; uri – if granting permission to a predefined group. Example: emailAddress="xyz@amazon.com", emailAddress="abc@amazon.com"

args.name: metadata
args.info: Optional: Array. A map of metadata to store with the object in S3. Example: ['<string>', ...]

args.name: SSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object. Valid Value: AES256

args.name: SSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer-provided base64-encoded encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.

args.name: SSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.

args.name: SSEKMSKeyId
args.info: Optional: If the x-amz-server-side-encryption is present and has the value of aws:kms, this header specifies the ID of the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) master encryption key that was used for the object.

args.name: serverSideEncryption
args.info: Optional: Specifies a server-side encryption algorithm to use when Amazon S3 creates an object. Valid Value: aws:kms, AES256

args.name: storageClass
args.info: Optional: If you don't specify, Standard is the default storage class. Amazon S3 supports other storage classes. Valid Values: STANDARD | STANDARD_IA | REDUCED_REDUNDANCY

args.name: websiteRedirectLocation
args.info: Optional: If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.

blocks.name: uploadPart
blocks.description: This operation uploads a part in a multipart upload.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be retrieved.

args.name: uploadBody
args.info: Required: File to be uploaded.

args.name: partNumber
args.info: Required: Part number of part being uploaded. This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000.

args.name: uploadId
args.info: Required: Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being uploaded.

args.name: contentLength
args.info: Optional: The size of the part, in bytes. For more information, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13.

args.name: contentSHA256
args.info: Optional: A SHA256 hash of the body content of the request.

args.name: SSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object. Valid Value: AES256

args.name: SSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer-provided base64-encoded encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.

args.name: SSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.

blocks.name: uploadPartCopy
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to uploads a part by copying data from an existing object as data source.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be copied.

args.name: copySource
args.info: Required: The name of the source bucket and key name of the source object, separated by a slash (/).

args.name: partNumber
args.info: Required: Part number of part being uploaded. This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000.

args.name: uploadId
args.info: Required: Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being uploaded.

args.name: copySourceIfMatch
args.info: Optional: Perform a copy if the source object entity tag (ETag) matches the specified value. If the value does not match, Amazon S3 returns an HTTP status code 412 precondition failed error.

args.name: copySourceIfModifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Perform a copy if the source object is modified after the time specified using this header. If the source object is not modified, Amazon S3 returns an HTTP status code 412 precondition failed error.

args.name: copySourceIfNoneMatch
args.info: Optional: Perform a copy if the source object entity tag (ETag) is different than the value specified using this header. If the values match, Amazon S3 returns an HTTP status code 412 precondition failed error.

args.name: copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince
args.info: Optional: Perform a copy if the source object is not modified after the time specified using this header. If the source object is modified, Amazon S3 returns an HTTP status code 412 precondition failed error.

args.name: copySourceRange
args.info: Optional: The range of bytes to copy from the source object. The range value must use the form bytes=first-last, where the first and last are the zero-based byte offsets to copy. For example, bytes=0-9 indicates that you want to copy the first ten bytes of the source.

args.name: copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies algorithm to use when decrypting the source object. Valid Value: AES256

args.name: copySourceSSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer provided base-64 encoded encryption key for Amazon S3 to use to decrypt the source object. The encryption key provided in this header must be one that was used when the source object was created.

args.name: copySourceSSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.

args.name: SSECustomerAlgorithm
args.info: Optional: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object. Valid Value: AES256

args.name: SSECustomerKey
args.info: Optional: Specifies the customer provided base64-encoded encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart upload request.

args.name: SSECustomerKeyMD5
args.info: Optional: Specifies the base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header as a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.

blocks.name: completeMultipartUpload
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to complete a multipart upload by assembling previously uploaded parts.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be copied.

args.name: parts
args.info: Required: Array of objects. Container for elements related to a particular previously uploaded part. See README for more details.

args.name: uploadId
args.info: Required: Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being uploaded.

blocks.name: abortMultipartUpload
blocks.description: This operation aborts a multipart upload. After a multipart upload is aborted, no additional parts can be uploaded using that upload ID.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be copied.

args.name: uploadId
args.info: Required: Upload ID identifying the multipart upload.

blocks.name: getParts
blocks.description: This operation lists the parts that have been uploaded for a specific multipart upload.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be copied.

args.name: uploadId
args.info: Required: Upload ID identifying the multipart upload.

args.name: encodingType
args.info: Optional: Requests Amazon S3 to encode the response and specifies the encoding method to use. Default: None. Valid value: url

args.name: maxParts
args.info: Optional: Sets the maximum number of parts to return in the response body. Default: 1,000

args.name: partNumberMarker
args.info: Optional: Specifies the part after which listing should begin. Only parts with higher part numbers will be listed.

blocks.name: deleteSingleObject
blocks.description: This operation removes the null version (if there is one) of an object and inserts a delete marker, which becomes the current version of the object. If there isn't a null version, Amazon S3 does not remove any objects.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objectName
args.info: Required: The name of the object to be copied.

args.name: MFA
args.info: Optional: The value is the concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space, and the value displayed on your authentication device. Default: None. Condition: Required to permanently delete a versioned object if versioning is configured with MFA Delete enabled.

args.name: versionId
args.info: Optional: VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.

blocks.name: deleteObjects
blocks.description: This operation enables you to delete multiple objects from a bucket using a single HTTP request. You may specify up to 1000 objects.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Amazon.

args.name: apiSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Amazon.

args.name: region
args.info: Required: Region.

args.name: bucketName
args.info: Required: The name of bucket.

args.name: objects
args.info: Required: Array of objects. Container element that describes the delete request for an object. See README for more details.

args.name: MFA
args.info: Optional: The value is the concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space, and the value displayed on your authentication device. Default: None. Condition: Required to permanently delete a versioned object if versioning is configured with MFA Delete enabled.

args.name: quiet
args.info: Optional: Element to enable quiet mode for the request. When you add this element, you must set its value to true. true || false
